sentences.en: 9 percent interest less 7 percent inflation equals 2 percent.
sentences.cn: 9%的利息减去7%的通货膨胀率等于2%。

sentences.en: At the last count inflation was 10.9 per cent.
sentences.cn: 最近一次统计显示通胀率为10.9%。

sentences.en: He fears inflation will ratchet up as the year ends.
sentences.cn: 他害怕通货膨胀会在年终更加严重。

sentences.en: He is tussling with the problem of what to do about inflation.
sentences.cn: 他正全力应对如何解决通货膨胀的问题。

sentences.en: If raging inflation returns, then interest rates will shoot up.
sentences.cn: 如果再发生严重的通货膨胀，那么利率就会迅速上调。

sentences.en: Inflation has turned the rouble into a toytown currency.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀使得卢布变成了毫无价值的货币。

sentences.en: Minimum pensions and wages are to be indexed to inflation.
sentences.cn: 最低养老金和最低工资要与通货膨胀挂钩。

sentences.en: Specialists see various reasons for the recent surge in inflation.
sentences.cn: 专家们认为目前通货膨胀加剧有多种原因。

sentences.en: The Chancellor is boxed in by inflation targets and sterling.
sentences.cn: 财政大臣被通货膨胀目标和英镑逼得束手无策。

sentences.en: The fall in inflation is the silver lining of the prolonged recession.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀的下降是长期经济衰退中的一线转机。

sentences.en: The inflation rate has been creeping up to 9.5 per cent.
The rate of inflation is running at about 2.7 percent.
The threat of inflation is already evident in bond prices.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀的危险在证券价格上已经表现得很明显。

sentences.en: They believed that controlling the money supply would reduce inflation.
sentences.cn: 他们相信控制货币供应量会减少通货膨胀。

sentences.en: Today's RPI figure shows inflation running at 10.9 per cent.
sentences.cn: 今天的零售物价指数显示通货膨胀率为10.9％。
